title: Alberto Watches — E-commerce & Brand Website
description: A premium e-commerce and brand website built to improve Alberto Watches’ online visibility, product discovery, and customer trust through a clean UI, structured content, and performance-focused frontend architecture.
problem: Alberto Watches had little to no structured online presence. Customers could not easily explore product categories, understand product features, or trust the brand digitally. The lack of a modern website limited brand visibility, discoverability, and customer confidence, especially for premium and luxury watch buyers.
solution: I designed and built a modern, high-end e-commerce website that presents Alberto Watches as a premium brand online. The solution focused on clear product categorization, strong visual hierarchy, fast navigation, and trust-building UI patterns such as detailed product pages, breadcrumbs, store locator, policies, and search functionality.
solutionPoints: Designed a clean, premium UI aligned with luxury watch branding
Built structured product categories (Luxury, Vintage, Sports, Smart) for easy discovery
Implemented dynamic routing for scalable product and case-study pages
Added search, breadcrumbs, and store locator to improve navigation and UX
Used skeleton loading and smooth transitions to eliminate layout jumps
Optimized layout and interactions for performance and responsiveness
results: Established a strong online presence for the Alberto Watches brand
Improved product discoverability and category clarity
Created a scalable frontend structure for future products and content
Delivered a premium, trust-focused user experience suitable for luxury buyers

title: Polio CRM — SaaS Landing Page
description: A conversion-focused SaaS landing page designed to position Polio as a flexible, AI-powered CRM while clearly communicating value, features, integrations, and social proof to drive free-trial signups.
problem: Polio needed a clear, modern landing page that could communicate a complex CRM product in a simple, compelling way. The challenge was presenting flexibility, AI-driven features, analytics, integrations, and trust signals without overwhelming users or hurting conversion.
solution: I designed and built a structured SaaS landing page that prioritizes clarity, scannability, and conversion. The page introduces Polio’s core value proposition upfront, reinforces trust through testimonials and integrations, and guides users toward starting a free trial using clear CTAs and progressive information hierarchy.
solutionPoints: Crafted a strong hero section with a clear value proposition and primary CTAs
Structured feature sections to explain complex CRM capabilities in simple language
Designed a scalable feature grid highlighting performance, security, and customization
Added integrations and social proof to build trust with enterprise-level users
Included testimonials from recognizable brands to reinforce credibility
Designed FAQ and footer sections to reduce friction before signup
results: Clear positioning of Polio as a flexible, AI-powered CRM
Improved clarity around product features and integrations
Strong conversion-focused layout with multiple free-trial entry points
Reusable layout structure suitable for future SaaS marketing pages

title: Student Progress Tracker
description: A lightweight web application for tracking student enrollment, course progress, and completion status, designed to help instructors and small training centers manage learners efficiently without complex LMS tools.
problem: Many small training centers, tutors, and bootcamps rely on spreadsheets or manual notes to track student progress. This leads to poor visibility into learner status, errors in record keeping, and difficulty measuring completion rates or engagement.
solution: I built a simple, focused student progress tracker that allows instructors to add students, assign courses, update progress status, and instantly view completion metrics. The interface is intentionally minimal to reduce friction and make daily tracking fast and intuitive.
solutionPoints: Designed a clean dashboard showing total students, completed, in-progress, and completion rate
Implemented student creation with course and progress status assignment
Built a filterable student list for quick course-based tracking
Used Tailwind CSS for rapid styling and consistent UI patterns
Structured the app for clarity and ease of use rather than feature overload
results: Improved visibility into student progress at a glance
Eliminated the need for manual spreadsheets for small class tracking
Created a reusable foundation for a lightweight LMS or admin dashboard
Demonstrated practical problem-solving using vanilla JavaScript and modern CSS
